alert.note: Alert for Esmeralda; Nye (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 1:37PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nevada, including the following counties, Esmeralda and Nye. * WHEN...Until 345 PM PDT. * IMPACTS....UPDATE...Overall, the inherited short term forecast is in good shape. Morning VWP from dicates that 700mb flow was already starting to increase into the 30- While high clouds are starting to invade from the west, sufficient daytime heating should promote a temperature lapse rate favorable for momentum transfer down to the surface. As such, the Wind Advisory (largely for gusts in excess of 40 mph) appears to be in fine shape for most of the AZ High Country today. Outside of loose outdoor articles being blown about (be sure to secure them), pockets of blowing dust will be on the table, particularly across the LCR, Navajo Nation and Hopi tribal areas. Confidence is medium to high that blowing dust will reduce visibility down to 4-5 miles. Large scale ascent continues to increase and this should yield increasing chances for largely high based convection---particularly across the Hualapai and Havasupai tribal areas and western parts of Grand Canyon Country. It`s here that the initial coverage of showers and a storm or two will range between 20-30% by 5pm MST. The coverage of precip will expand as we venture into the early evening hours, especially for areas near and west of a Page to Prescott line. Some of the higher elevations (above 8,000 feet) will have the opportunity to see a few snowflakes flying as cooler air aloft filters in. Significant accumulations of snow (> 2") are not anticipated at this time, however, Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Areas of moderate to heavy rainfall have been occurring * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 137 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. NWS employee reports that areas of moderate to heavy rainfall has been occurring along Highway 95. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.50 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lida, Lida Junction, Scottys Junction, Gold Point and Goldfield. - Highway 95, State Route 266 and Scottys Castle Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
